page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
Many people seem to think that Lincolnshire is very flat, but in our area we have quite a few hills, in fact it is quite undulating. In our area we have one large village one small village and three hamlets. It is a quiet rural area which has been inhabited since the Iron Age.
There is local evidence of the Iron Age near Scotland Lane and of the Roman occupation just North of Lenton. On the eastern side of the Sapperton Road in Lenton there is an unusual field.In the field there are a number of small hills.We think that these hillocks have been there since Roman times. We think that they were Roman fish ponds. Now cows and sheep graze there.
